Problem:

If at a certain time \\( t_1 \\), an intervention operation \\( U(x) = Px + Q \\) (where P and Q are matrices) is utilized, will the final state \\( x(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend solely on D and not on M, N, P, or Q?
Explanation: Both initial transformation \\( T(x) \\) and the intervention \\( U(x) \\) introduce changes through matrices M, N, P, and Q. Even after the interruption at \\( t_1 \\), the state of \\( x(T) \\) still reflects the effects of these transformations, along with the dynamic matrix D.
